data.message: It's not that we hate change, it's that you have always changed to the WORSE, which explains why the rate of people joining Facebook has declined and will drop further and faster if you stop treating us as "products" and if you stop pretending that you care about our "privacy"!

replies.message: Not only do they pretend to care about our "privacy" they also pretend to care about what we think as the users.
They just give out our private information when ever they want and don't care.
If you don't pay for a service you ARE the product. Welcome to Capitalism.
when have they ever cared about our privacy?
Privacy?  Try Googling, say wild horses for sale, you'll find a Sponsored notice on your page within the hour trying to sell you "wild horses"!

Scrolling through here, I have not seen one positive comment about the new look.  MAYBE WE DON'T LIKE IT.  All you did was increase the area for more advertising.  I too, want to see all my friend's posts.  That's why I have them as a friend.  Facebook could save some money by eliminating the job of the person who keeps screwing up the Facebook feed.
hate it .. the timeline moves much slower with less people interaction change it back
No I don't lke it and my chat section is not where it was before  Like they say if it's not broke don't fix it !!!
Do you think I am blind? I liked it better when I could see more fees at once.
I agree, it's not the idea of change per se..,but the new news feed actually feels more cluttered and more difficult to use, which I assume was NOT what you were going for.
we don't like the new look stop making all these changes
Privacy? I just figure that every keystroke I make online is open to the public and the government if they really want it. Don't matter if it's a private message or an Email or FB posting.
I hate the pop ups that want me to change things on my computer, they take over what I am writing and when I look up I have lost my message, have to start all over.
I might just ge off of it like a lot are ddoing , it sucks ...

@ Nathan Schilz If you don't pay for a service you ARE the product. Welcome to Capitalism.

Actually WE SHOULD BE PAID as we PROVIDE the product.
That's EXACTLY what we are though. We USED to be people, maybe even valued users at one point. Those days are gone though and ADVERTISERS are people while we are products.
In every business it rizes the max and start to fall due somany factors so u have to suit your business and conssumers max cons
